JobFlowId.name: JobFlowId
JobFlowId.description: Job flow in which to add the instance groups.

JobFlowId.name: JobFlowId
JobFlowId.description: The job flow ID in which the instance groups are added.

InstanceGroupIds.name: InstanceGroupIds
InstanceGroupIds.description: Instance group IDs of the newly created instance groups.

AddJobFlowStepsInput.name: AddJobFlowStepsInput
AddJobFlowStepsInput.description: The input argument to the AddJobFlowSteps operation.

JobFlowId.name: JobFlowId
JobFlowId.description: A string that uniquely identifies the job flow. This identifier is returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from ListClusters.

Steps.name: Steps
Steps.description: A list of StepConfig to be executed by the job flow.

StepIds.name: StepIds
StepIds.description: The identifiers of the list of steps added to the job flow.

AddTagsInput.name: AddTagsInput
AddTagsInput.description: This input identifies a cluster and a list of tags to attach.

ResourceId.name: ResourceId
ResourceId.description: The Amazon EMR resource identifier to which tags will be added. This value must be a cluster identifier.

Tags.name: Tags
Tags.description: A list of tags to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2 instances. Tags are user-defined key/value pairs that consist of a required key string with a maximum of 128 characters, and an optional value string with a maximum of 256 characters.

AddTagsOutput.name: AddTagsOutput
AddTagsOutput.description: This output indicates the result of adding tags to a resource.

Application.name: Application
Application.description:
An application is any Amazon or third-party software that you can add to the cluster. This structure contains a list of strings that indicates the software to use with the cluster and accepts a user argument list. Amazon EMR accepts and forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as bootstrap action argument. For more information, see Launch a Job Flow on the MapR Distribution for Hadoop. Currently supported values are:

  • "mapr-m3" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 Edition.

  • "mapr-m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M5 Edition.

  • "mapr" with the user arguments specifying "--edition,m3" or "--edition,m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 or M5 Edition, respectively.

In Amazon EMR releases 4.0 and greater, the only accepted parameter is the application name. To pass arguments to applications, you supply a configuration for each application.

Args.name: Args
Args.description: Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.

AdditionalInfo.name: AdditionalInfo
AdditionalInfo.description: This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing purposes.

BootstrapActionDetail.name: BootstrapActionDetail
BootstrapActionDetail.description: Reports the configuration of a bootstrap action in a job flow.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The current status details about the cluster.

LogUri.name: LogUri
LogUri.description: The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are stored.

RequestedAmiVersion.name: RequestedAmiVersion
RequestedAmiVersion.description: The AMI version requested for this cluster.

RunningAmiVersion.name: RunningAmiVersion
RunningAmiVersion.description: The AMI version running on this cluster.

ReleaseLabel.name: ReleaseLabel
ReleaseLabel.description: The release label for the Amazon EMR release. For Amazon EMR 3.x and 2.x AMIs, use amiVersion instead instead of ReleaseLabel.

AutoTerminate.name: AutoTerminate
AutoTerminate.description: Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all steps.

TerminationProtected.name: TerminationProtected
TerminationProtected.description: Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the EC2 instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a cluster error.

VisibleToAllUsers.name: VisibleToAllUsers
VisibleToAllUsers.description: Indicates whether the job flow is visible to all IAM users of the AWS account associated with the job flow. If this value is set to true, all IAM users of that AWS account can view and manage the job flow if they have the proper policy permissions set. If this value is false, only the IAM user that created the cluster can view and manage it. This value can be changed using the SetVisibleToAllUsers action.

Tags.name: Tags
Tags.description: A list of tags associated with a cluster.

ServiceRole.name: ServiceRole
ServiceRole.description: The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access AWS resources on your behalf.

NormalizedInstanceHours.name: NormalizedInstanceHours
NormalizedInstanceHours.description: An approximation of the cost of the job flow, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

MasterPublicDnsName.name: MasterPublicDnsName
MasterPublicDnsName.description: The public DNS name of the master EC2 instance.

Configurations.name: Configurations
Configurations.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

The list of Configurations supplied to the EMR cluster.

SecurityConfiguration.name: SecurityConfiguration
SecurityConfiguration.description: The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.

ClusterStateChangeReason.name: ClusterStateChangeReason
ClusterStateChangeReason.description: The reason that the cluster changed to its current state.

Code.name: Code
Code.description: The programmatic code for the state change reason.

Message.name: Message
Message.description: The descriptive message for the state change reason.

StateChangeReason.name: StateChangeReason
StateChangeReason.description: The reason for the cluster status change.

Timeline.name: Timeline
Timeline.description: A timeline that represents the status of a cluster over the lifetime of the cluster.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The details about the current status of the cluster.

NormalizedInstanceHours.name: NormalizedInstanceHours
NormalizedInstanceHours.description: An approximation of the cost of the job flow, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

ClusterTimeline.name: ClusterTimeline
ClusterTimeline.description: Represents the timeline of the cluster's lifecycle.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the cluster.

ReadyDateTime.name: ReadyDateTime
ReadyDateTime.description: The date and time when the cluster was ready to execute steps.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the cluster was terminated.

Command.name: Command
Command.description: An entity describing an executable that runs on a cluster.

ScriptPath.name: ScriptPath
ScriptPath.description: The Amazon S3 location of the command script.

Args.name: Args
Args.description: Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the command for execution.

Configuration.name: Configuration
Configuration.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

Specifies a hardware and software configuration of the EMR cluster. This includes configurations for applications and software bundled with Amazon EMR. The Configuration object is a JSON object which is defined by a classification and a set of properties. Configurations can be nested, so a configuration may have its own Configuration objects listed.

Classification.name: Classification
Classification.description: The classification of a configuration. For more information see, Amazon EMR Configurations.

Configurations.name: Configurations
Configurations.description: A list of configurations you apply to this configuration object.

Properties.name: Properties
Properties.description: A set of properties supplied to the Configuration object.

SecurityConfiguration.name: SecurityConfiguration
SecurityConfiguration.description: The security configuration details in JSON format.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The date and time the security configuration was created.

DescribeClusterInput.name: DescribeClusterInput
DescribeClusterInput.description: This input determines which cluster to describe.

ClusterId.name: ClusterId
ClusterId.description: The identifier of the cluster to describe.

DescribeClusterOutput.name: DescribeClusterOutput
DescribeClusterOutput.description: This output contains the description of the cluster.

Cluster.name: Cluster
Cluster.description: This output contains the details for the requested cluster.

CreatedAfter.name: CreatedAfter
CreatedAfter.description: Return only job flows created after this date and time.

CreatedBefore.name: CreatedBefore
CreatedBefore.description: Return only job flows created before this date and time.

JobFlowIds.name: JobFlowIds
JobFlowIds.description: Return only job flows whose job flow ID is contained in this list.

JobFlowStates.name: JobFlowStates
JobFlowStates.description: Return only job flows whose state is contained in this list.

JobFlows.name: JobFlows
JobFlows.description: A list of job flows matching the parameters supplied.

SecurityConfiguration.name: SecurityConfiguration
SecurityConfiguration.description: The security configuration details in JSON format.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The date and time the security configuration was created

DescribeStepInput.name: DescribeStepInput
DescribeStepInput.description: This input determines which step to describe.

ClusterId.name: ClusterId
ClusterId.description: The identifier of the cluster with steps to describe.

StepId.name: StepId
StepId.description: The identifier of the step to describe.

DescribeStepOutput.name: DescribeStepOutput
DescribeStepOutput.description: This output contains the description of the cluster step.

Step.name: Step
Step.description: The step details for the requested step identifier.

EbsBlockDevice.name: EbsBlockDevice
EbsBlockDevice.description: Configuration of requested EBS block device associated with the instance group.

VolumeSpecification.name: VolumeSpecification
VolumeSpecification.description: EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size(GiB) that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance in the cluster.

Device.name: Device
Device.description: The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.

EbsBlockDeviceConfig.name: EbsBlockDeviceConfig
EbsBlockDeviceConfig.description: Configuration of requested EBS block device associated with the instance group with count of volumes that will be associated to every instance.

VolumeSpecification.name: VolumeSpecification
VolumeSpecification.description: EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size(GiB) that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance in the cluster.

VolumesPerInstance.name: VolumesPerInstance
VolumesPerInstance.description: Number of EBS volumes with specific volume configuration, that will be associated with every instance in the instance group

EbsVolume.name: EbsVolume
EbsVolume.description: EBS block device that's attached to an EC2 instance.

Device.name: Device
Device.description: The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.

VolumeId.name: VolumeId
VolumeId.description: The volume identifier of the EBS volume.

Ec2InstanceAttributes.name: Ec2InstanceAttributes
Ec2InstanceAttributes.description: Provides information about the EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and so on.

Ec2KeyName.name: Ec2KeyName
Ec2KeyName.description: The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair to use when connecting with SSH into the master node as a user named "hadoop".

Ec2SubnetId.name: Ec2SubnetId
Ec2SubnetId.description:
To launch the job flow in Amazon VPC, set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the job flow to launch. If you do not specify this value, the job flow is launched in the normal AWS cloud, outside of a VPC.

Amazon VPC currently does not support cluster compute quadruple extra large (cc1.4xlarge) instances. Thus, you cannot specify the cc1.4xlarge instance type for nodes of a job flow launched in a VPC.

Ec2AvailabilityZone.name: Ec2AvailabilityZone
Ec2AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone in which the cluster will run.

IamInstanceProfile.name: IamInstanceProfile
IamInstanceProfile.description: The IAM role that was specified when the job flow was launched. The EC2 instances of the job flow assume this role.

EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.name: EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup
EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.

EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.name: EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup
EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the slave nodes.

ServiceAccessSecurityGroup.name: ServiceAccessSecurityGroup
ServiceAccessSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.

AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups.name: AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups
AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.

AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups.name: AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups
AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the slave nodes.

FailureDetails.name: FailureDetails
FailureDetails.description: The details of the step failure. The service attempts to detect the root cause for many common failures.

Reason.name: Reason
Reason.description: The reason for the step failure. In the case where the service cannot successfully determine the root cause of the failure, it returns "Unknown Error" as a reason.

Message.name: Message
Message.description: The descriptive message including the error the EMR service has identified as the cause of step failure. This is text from an error log that describes the root cause of the failure.

LogFile.name: LogFile
LogFile.description: The path to the log file where the step failure root cause was originally recorded.

HadoopJarStepConfig.name: HadoopJarStepConfig
HadoopJarStepConfig.description: A job flow step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be executed. The main function submits a job for Hadoop to execute and waits for the job to finish or fail.

Properties.name: Properties
Properties.description: A list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass key value pairs to your main function.

Jar.name: Jar
Jar.description: A path to a JAR file run during the step.

MainClass.name: MainClass
MainClass.description: The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify a Main-Class in its manifest file.

Args.name: Args
Args.description: A list of command line arguments passed to the JAR file's main function when executed.

HadoopStepConfig.name: HadoopStepConfig
HadoopStepConfig.description: A cluster step consisting of a JAR file whose main function will be executed. The main function submits a job for Hadoop to execute and waits for the job to finish or fail.

Jar.name: Jar
Jar.description: The path to the JAR file that runs during the step.

Properties.name: Properties
Properties.description: The list of Java properties that are set when the step runs. You can use these properties to pass key value pairs to your main function.

MainClass.name: MainClass
MainClass.description: The name of the main class in the specified Java file. If not specified, the JAR file should specify a main class in its manifest file.

Args.name: Args
Args.description: The list of command line arguments to pass to the JAR file's main function for execution.

Instance.name: Instance
Instance.description: Represents an EC2 instance provisioned as part of cluster.

Id.name: Id
Id.description: The unique identifier for the instance in Amazon EMR.

Ec2InstanceId.name: Ec2InstanceId
Ec2InstanceId.description: The unique identifier of the instance in Amazon EC2.

PublicDnsName.name: PublicDnsName
PublicDnsName.description: The public DNS name of the instance.

PublicIpAddress.name: PublicIpAddress
PublicIpAddress.description: The public IP address of the instance.

PrivateDnsName.name: PrivateDnsName
PrivateDnsName.description: The private DNS name of the instance.

PrivateIpAddress.name: PrivateIpAddress
PrivateIpAddress.description: The private IP address of the instance.

InstanceGroupId.name: InstanceGroupId
InstanceGroupId.description: The identifier of the instance group to which this instance belongs.

EbsVolumes.name: EbsVolumes
EbsVolumes.description: The list of EBS volumes that are attached to this instance.

InstanceGroup.name: InstanceGroup
InstanceGroup.description: This entity represents an instance group, which is a group of instances that have common purpose. For example, CORE instance group is used for HDFS.

Market.name: Market
Market.description: The marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values are ON_DEMAND or SPOT.

InstanceGroupType.name: InstanceGroupType
InstanceGroupType.description: The type of the instance group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.

BidPrice.name: BidPrice
BidPrice.description: The bid price for each EC2 instance in the instance group when launching nodes as Spot Instances, expressed in USD.

InstanceType.name: InstanceType
InstanceType.description: The EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.

RequestedInstanceCount.name: RequestedInstanceCount
RequestedInstanceCount.description: The target number of instances for the instance group.

RunningInstanceCount.name: RunningInstanceCount
RunningInstanceCount.description: The number of instances currently running in this instance group.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The current status of the instance group.

Configurations.name: Configurations
Configurations.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group (master, core, and task).

EbsBlockDevices.name: EbsBlockDevices
EbsBlockDevices.description: The EBS block devices that are mapped to this instance group.

EbsOptimized.name: EbsOptimized
EbsOptimized.description: If the instance group is EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized instance uses an optimized configuration stack and provides additional, dedicated capacity for Amazon EBS I/O.

Name.name: Name
Name.description: Friendly name given to the instance group.

Market.name: Market
Market.description: Market type of the Amazon EC2 instances used to create a cluster node.

InstanceRole.name: InstanceRole
InstanceRole.description: The role of the instance group in the cluster.

BidPrice.name: BidPrice
BidPrice.description: Bid price for each Amazon EC2 instance in the instance group when launching nodes as Spot Instances, expressed in USD.

InstanceType.name: InstanceType
InstanceType.description: The Amazon EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.

InstanceCount.name: InstanceCount
InstanceCount.description: Target number of instances for the instance group.

Configurations.name: Configurations
Configurations.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

The list of configurations supplied for an EMR cluster instance group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group (master, core, and task).

EbsConfiguration.name: EbsConfiguration
EbsConfiguration.description: EBS configurations that will be attached to each Amazon EC2 instance in the instance group.

Market.name: Market
Market.description: Market type of the Amazon EC2 instances used to create a cluster node.

BidPrice.name: BidPrice
BidPrice.description: Bid price for EC2 Instances when launching nodes as Spot Instances, expressed in USD.

InstanceRequestCount.name: InstanceRequestCount
InstanceRequestCount.description: Target number of instances to run in the instance group.

State.name: State
State.description: State of instance group. The following values are deprecated: STARTING, TERMINATED, and FAILED.

LastStateChangeReason.name: LastStateChangeReason
LastStateChangeReason.description: Details regarding the state of the instance group.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The date/time the instance group was created.

StartDateTime.name: StartDateTime
StartDateTime.description: The date/time the instance group was started.

ReadyDateTime.name: ReadyDateTime
ReadyDateTime.description: The date/time the instance group was available to the cluster.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The date/time the instance group was terminated.

InstanceGroupId.name: InstanceGroupId
InstanceGroupId.description: Unique ID of the instance group to expand or shrink.

EC2InstanceIdsToTerminate.name: EC2InstanceIdsToTerminate
EC2InstanceIdsToTerminate.description: The EC2 InstanceIds to terminate. Once you terminate the instances, the instance group will not return to its original requested size.

InstanceGroupStateChangeReason.name: InstanceGroupStateChangeReason
InstanceGroupStateChangeReason.description: The status change reason details for the instance group.

Code.name: Code
Code.description: The programmable code for the state change reason.

InstanceGroupStatus.name: InstanceGroupStatus
InstanceGroupStatus.description: The details of the instance group status.

State.name: State
State.description: The current state of the instance group.

StateChangeReason.name: StateChangeReason
StateChangeReason.description: The status change reason details for the instance group.

Timeline.name: Timeline
Timeline.description: The timeline of the instance group status over time.

InstanceGroupTimeline.name: InstanceGroupTimeline
InstanceGroupTimeline.description: The timeline of the instance group lifecycle.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the instance group.

ReadyDateTime.name: ReadyDateTime
ReadyDateTime.description: The date and time when the instance group became ready to perform tasks.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the instance group terminated.

InstanceResizePolicy.name: InstanceResizePolicy
InstanceResizePolicy.description: Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances when shrinking an instance group.

InstancesToTerminate.name: InstancesToTerminate
InstancesToTerminate.description: Specific list of instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance group.

InstancesToProtect.name: InstancesToProtect
InstancesToProtect.description: Specific list of instances to be protected when shrinking an instance group.

InstanceTerminationTimeout.name: InstanceTerminationTimeout
InstanceTerminationTimeout.description: Decommissioning timeout override for the specific list of instances to be terminated.

InstanceStateChangeReason.name: InstanceStateChangeReason
InstanceStateChangeReason.description: The details of the status change reason for the instance.

Code.name: Code
Code.description: The programmable code for the state change reason.

StateChangeReason.name: StateChangeReason
StateChangeReason.description: The details of the status change reason for the instance.

Timeline.name: Timeline
Timeline.description: The timeline of the instance status over time.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the instance.

ReadyDateTime.name: ReadyDateTime
ReadyDateTime.description: The date and time when the instance was ready to perform tasks.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the instance was terminated.

LogUri.name: LogUri
LogUri.description: The location in Amazon S3 where log files for the job are stored.

AmiVersion.name: AmiVersion
AmiVersion.description: The version of the AMI used to initialize Amazon EC2 instances in the job flow. For a list of AMI versions currently supported by Amazon ElasticMapReduce, go to AMI Versions Supported in Elastic MapReduce in the Amazon Elastic MapReduce Developer Guide.

ExecutionStatusDetail.name: ExecutionStatusDetail
ExecutionStatusDetail.description: Describes the execution status of the job flow.

Instances.name: Instances
Instances.description: Describes the Amazon EC2 instances of the job flow.

Steps.name: Steps
Steps.description: A list of steps run by the job flow.

BootstrapActions.name: BootstrapActions
BootstrapActions.description: A list of the bootstrap actions run by the job flow.

SupportedProducts.name: SupportedProducts
SupportedProducts.description: A list of strings set by third party software when the job flow is launched. If you are not using third party software to manage the job flow this value is empty.

VisibleToAllUsers.name: VisibleToAllUsers
VisibleToAllUsers.description: Specifies whether the job flow is visible to all IAM users of the AWS account associated with the job flow. If this value is set to true, all IAM users of that AWS account can view and (if they have the proper policy permissions set) manage the job flow. If it is set to false, only the IAM user that created the job flow can view and manage it. This value can be changed using the SetVisibleToAllUsers action.

JobFlowRole.name: JobFlowRole
JobFlowRole.description: The IAM role that was specified when the job flow was launched. The EC2 instances of the job flow assume this role.

ServiceRole.name: ServiceRole
ServiceRole.description: The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access AWS resources on your behalf.

JobFlowExecutionStatusDetail.name: JobFlowExecutionStatusDetail
JobFlowExecutionStatusDetail.description: Describes the status of the job flow.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the job flow.

StartDateTime.name: StartDateTime
StartDateTime.description: The start date and time of the job flow.

ReadyDateTime.name: ReadyDateTime
ReadyDateTime.description: The date and time when the job flow was ready to start running bootstrap actions.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The completion date and time of the job flow.

LastStateChangeReason.name: LastStateChangeReason
LastStateChangeReason.description: Description of the job flow last changed state.

JobFlowInstancesConfig.name: JobFlowInstancesConfig
JobFlowInstancesConfig.description: A description of the Amazon EC2 instance running the job flow. A valid JobFlowInstancesConfig must contain at least InstanceGroups, which is the recommended configuration. However, a valid alternative is to have MasterInstanceType, SlaveInstanceType, and InstanceCount (all three must be present).

MasterInstanceType.name: MasterInstanceType
MasterInstanceType.description: The EC2 instance type of the master node.

SlaveInstanceType.name: SlaveInstanceType
SlaveInstanceType.description: The EC2 instance type of the slave nodes.

InstanceCount.name: InstanceCount
InstanceCount.description: The number of Amazon EC2 instances used to execute the job flow.

InstanceGroups.name: InstanceGroups
InstanceGroups.description: Configuration for the job flow's instance groups.

Ec2KeyName.name: Ec2KeyName
Ec2KeyName.description: The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair that can be used to ssh to the master node as the user called "hadoop."

Placement.name: Placement
Placement.description: The Availability Zone the job flow will run in.

KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps.name: KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps
KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps.description: Specifies whether the job flow should be kept alive after completing all steps.

TerminationProtected.name: TerminationProtected
TerminationProtected.description: Specifies whether to lock the job flow to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a job flow error.

HadoopVersion.name: HadoopVersion
HadoopVersion.description: The Hadoop version for the job flow. Valid inputs are "0.18" (deprecated), "0.20" (deprecated), "0.20.205" (deprecated), "1.0.3", "2.2.0", or "2.4.0". If you do not set this value, the default of 0.18 is used, unless the AmiVersion parameter is set in the RunJobFlow call, in which case the default version of Hadoop for that AMI version is used.

Ec2SubnetId.name: Ec2SubnetId
Ec2SubnetId.description:
To launch the job flow in Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC), set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the job flow to launch. If you do not specify this value, the job flow is launched in the normal Amazon Web Services cloud, outside of an Amazon VPC.

Amazon VPC currently does not support cluster compute quadruple extra large (cc1.4xlarge) instances. Thus you cannot specify the cc1.4xlarge instance type for nodes of a job flow launched in a Amazon VPC.

EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.name: EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup
EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.

EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.name: EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup
EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the slave nodes.

ServiceAccessSecurityGroup.name: ServiceAccessSecurityGroup
ServiceAccessSecurityGroup.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.

AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups.name: AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups
AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.

AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups.name: AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups
AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the slave nodes.

JobFlowInstancesDetail.name: JobFlowInstancesDetail
JobFlowInstancesDetail.description: Specify the type of Amazon EC2 instances to run the job flow on.

MasterInstanceType.name: MasterInstanceType
MasterInstanceType.description: The Amazon EC2 master node instance type.

MasterPublicDnsName.name: MasterPublicDnsName
MasterPublicDnsName.description: The DNS name of the master node.

MasterInstanceId.name: MasterInstanceId
MasterInstanceId.description: The Amazon EC2 instance identifier of the master node.

SlaveInstanceType.name: SlaveInstanceType
SlaveInstanceType.description: The Amazon EC2 slave node instance type.

InstanceCount.name: InstanceCount
InstanceCount.description: The number of Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster. If the value is 1, the same instance serves as both the master and slave node. If the value is greater than 1, one instance is the master node and all others are slave nodes.

InstanceGroups.name: InstanceGroups
InstanceGroups.description: Details about the job flow's instance groups.

NormalizedInstanceHours.name: NormalizedInstanceHours
NormalizedInstanceHours.description: An approximation of the cost of the job flow, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is incremented once for every hour an m1.small runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an Amazon EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

Ec2KeyName.name: Ec2KeyName
Ec2KeyName.description: The name of an Amazon EC2 key pair that can be used to ssh to the master node of job flow.

Ec2SubnetId.name: Ec2SubnetId
Ec2SubnetId.description: For job flows launched within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, this value specifies the identifier of the subnet where the job flow was launched.

Placement.name: Placement
Placement.description: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the job flow.

KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps.name: KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps
KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps.description: Specifies whether the job flow should terminate after completing all steps.

TerminationProtected.name: TerminationProtected
TerminationProtected.description: Specifies whether the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster are protected from termination by API calls, user intervention, or in the event of a job flow error.

HadoopVersion.name: HadoopVersion
HadoopVersion.description: The Hadoop version for the job flow.

Key.name: Key
Key.description: The unique identifier of a key value pair.

Value.name: Value
Value.description: The value part of the identified key.

ListBootstrapActionsInput.name: ListBootstrapActionsInput
ListBootstrapActionsInput.description: This input determines which bootstrap actions to retrieve.

ClusterId.name: ClusterId

ListInstanceGroupsInput.description: This input determines which instance groups to retrieve.

Marker.description: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.

ListInstanceGroupsOutput.description: This input determines which instance groups to retrieve.

InstanceGroups.name: InstanceGroups

InstanceGroupId.name: InstanceGroupId

PlacementType.name: PlacementType

AvailabilityZone.name: AvailabilityZone
AvailabilityZone.description: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone for the job flow.

RemoveTagsInput.name: RemoveTagsInput
RemoveTagsInput.description: This input identifies a cluster and a list of tags to remove.

ResourceId.name: ResourceId
ResourceId.description: The Amazon EMR resource identifier from which tags will be removed. This value must be a cluster identifier.

TagKeys.name: TagKeys
TagKeys.description: A list of tag keys to remove from a resource.

RemoveTagsOutput.name: RemoveTagsOutput
RemoveTagsOutput.description: This output indicates the result of removing tags from a resource.

LogUri.name: LogUri
LogUri.description: The location in Amazon S3 to write the log files of the job flow. If a value is not provided, logs are not created.

AdditionalInfo.name: AdditionalInfo
AdditionalInfo.description: A JSON string for selecting additional features.

AmiVersion.name: AmiVersion
AmiVersion.description:
For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and greater, use ReleaseLabel.

The version of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to use when launching Amazon EC2 instances in the job flow. The following values are valid:

  • The version number of the AMI to use, for example, "2.0."

If the AMI supports multiple versions of Hadoop (for example, AMI 1.0 supports both Hadoop 0.18 and 0.20) you can use the JobFlowInstancesConfig HadoopVersion parameter to modify the version of Hadoop from the defaults shown above.

For details about the AMI versions currently supported by Amazon Elastic MapReduce, go to AMI Versions Supported in Elastic MapReduce in the Amazon Elastic MapReduce Developer's Guide.

ReleaseLabel.name: ReleaseLabel
ReleaseLabel.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

The release label for the Amazon EMR release. For Amazon EMR 3.x and 2.x AMIs, use amiVersion instead instead of ReleaseLabel.

Instances.name: Instances
Instances.description: A specification of the number and type of Amazon EC2 instances on which to run the job flow.

Steps.name: Steps
Steps.description: A list of steps to be executed by the job flow.

BootstrapActions.name: BootstrapActions
BootstrapActions.description: A list of bootstrap actions that will be run before Hadoop is started on the cluster nodes.

SupportedProducts.name: SupportedProducts
SupportedProducts.description:
For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and greater, use Applications.

A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the job flow. For more information, go to Use Third Party Applications with Amazon EMR. Currently supported values are:

  • "mapr-m3" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 Edition.

  • "mapr-m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M5 Edition.

NewSupportedProducts.name: NewSupportedProducts
NewSupportedProducts.description:
For Amazon EMR releases 3.x and 2.x. For Amazon EMR releases 4.x and greater, use Applications.

A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the job flow that accepts a user argument list. EMR accepts and forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as bootstrap action arguments. For more information, see Launch a Job Flow on the MapR Distribution for Hadoop. Currently supported values are:

  • "mapr-m3" - launch the cluster using MapR M3 Edition.

  • "mapr-m5" - launch the cluster using MapR M5 Edition.

  • "mapr" with the user arguments specifying "--edition,m3" or "--edition,m5" - launch the job flow using MapR M3 or M5 Edition respectively.

  • "mapr-m7" - launch the cluster using MapR M7 Edition.

  • "hunk" - launch the cluster with the Hunk Big Data Analtics Platform.

  • "hue"- launch the cluster with Hue installed.

  • "spark" - launch the cluster with Apache Spark installed.

  • "ganglia" - launch the cluster with the Ganglia Monitoring System installed.

Applications.name: Applications
Applications.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

A list of applications for the cluster. Valid values are: "Hadoop", "Hive", "Mahout", "Pig", and "Spark." They are case insensitive.

Configurations.name: Configurations
Configurations.description:
Amazon EMR releases 4.x or later.

The list of configurations supplied for the EMR cluster you are creating.

VisibleToAllUsers.name: VisibleToAllUsers
VisibleToAllUsers.description: Whether the job flow is visible to all IAM users of the AWS account associated with the job flow. If this value is set to true, all IAM users of that AWS account can view and (if they have the proper policy permissions set) manage the job flow. If it is set to false, only the IAM user that created the job flow can view and manage it.

JobFlowRole.name: JobFlowRole
JobFlowRole.description: Also called instance profile and EC2 role. An IAM role for an EMR cluster. The EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role. The default role is EMR_EC2_DefaultRole. In order to use the default role, you must have already created it using the CLI or console.

ServiceRole.name: ServiceRole
ServiceRole.description: The IAM role that will be assumed by the Amazon EMR service to access AWS resources on your behalf.

Tags.name: Tags
Tags.description: A list of tags to associate with a cluster and propagate to Amazon EC2 instances.

SecurityConfiguration.name: SecurityConfiguration
SecurityConfiguration.description: The name of a security configuration to apply to the cluster.

JobFlowId.name: JobFlowId
JobFlowId.description: An unique identifier for the job flow.

SecurityConfigurationSummary.name: SecurityConfigurationSummary
SecurityConfigurationSummary.description: The creation date and time, and name, of a security configuration.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The date and time the security configuration was created.

SetTerminationProtectionInput.name: SetTerminationProtectionInput
SetTerminationProtectionInput.description: The input argument to the TerminationProtection operation.

JobFlowIds.name: JobFlowIds
JobFlowIds.description: A list of strings that uniquely identify the job flows to protect. This identifier is returned by RunJobFlow and can also be obtained from DescribeJobFlows .

TerminationProtected.name: TerminationProtected
TerminationProtected.description: A Boolean that indicates whether to protect the job flow and prevent the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster from shutting down due to API calls, user intervention, or job-flow error.

JobFlowIds.name: JobFlowIds
JobFlowIds.description: Identifiers of the job flows to receive the new visibility setting.

VisibleToAllUsers.name: VisibleToAllUsers
VisibleToAllUsers.description: Whether the specified job flows are visible to all IAM users of the AWS account associated with the job flow. If this value is set to True, all IAM users of that AWS account can view and, if they have the proper IAM policy permissions set, manage the job flows. If it is set to False, only the IAM user that created a job flow can view and manage it.

ShrinkPolicy.name: ShrinkPolicy
ShrinkPolicy.description: Policy for customizing shrink operations. Allows configuration of decommissioning timeout and targeted instance shrinking.

DecommissionTimeout.name: DecommissionTimeout
DecommissionTimeout.description: The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance. Overrides the default YARN decommissioning timeout.

InstanceResizePolicy.name: InstanceResizePolicy
InstanceResizePolicy.description: Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances when shrinking an instance group.

Step.name: Step
Step.description: This represents a step in a cluster.

Config.name: Config
Config.description: The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.

ActionOnFailure.name: ActionOnFailure
ActionOnFailure.description: This specifies what action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are TERMINATE_CLUSTER, CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The current execution status details of the cluster step.

Name.name: Name
Name.description: The name of the job flow step.

ActionOnFailure.name: ActionOnFailure
ActionOnFailure.description: The action to take if the job flow step fails.

HadoopJarStep.name: HadoopJarStep
HadoopJarStep.description: The JAR file used for the job flow step.

StepDetail.name: StepDetail
StepDetail.description: Combines the execution state and configuration of a step.

State.name: State
State.description: The state of the job flow step.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the step.

StartDateTime.name: StartDateTime
StartDateTime.description: The start date and time of the step.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The completion date and time of the step.

LastStateChangeReason.name: LastStateChangeReason
LastStateChangeReason.description: A description of the step's current state.

StepStateChangeReason.name: StepStateChangeReason
StepStateChangeReason.description: The details of the step state change reason.

Code.name: Code
Code.description: The programmable code for the state change reason. Note: Currently, the service provides no code for the state change.

Message.name: Message
Message.description: The descriptive message for the state change reason.

StepStatus.name: StepStatus
StepStatus.description: The execution status details of the cluster step.

State.name: State
State.description: The execution state of the cluster step.

StateChangeReason.name: StateChangeReason
StateChangeReason.description: The reason for the step execution status change.

FailureDetails.name: FailureDetails
FailureDetails.description: The details for the step failure including reason, message, and log file path where the root cause was identified.

Timeline.name: Timeline
Timeline.description: The timeline of the cluster step status over time.

Config.name: Config
Config.description: The Hadoop job configuration of the cluster step.

ActionOnFailure.name: ActionOnFailure
ActionOnFailure.description: This specifies what action to take when the cluster step fails. Possible values are TERMINATE_CLUSTER, CANCEL_AND_WAIT, and CONTINUE.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: The current execution status details of the cluster step.

StepTimeline.name: StepTimeline
StepTimeline.description: The timeline of the cluster step lifecycle.

CreationDateTime.name: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description: The date and time when the cluster step was created.

StartDateTime.name: StartDateTime
StartDateTime.description: The date and time when the cluster step execution started.

EndDateTime.name: EndDateTime
EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the cluster step execution completed or failed.

SupportedProductConfig.name: SupportedProductConfig
SupportedProductConfig.description: The list of supported product configurations which allow user-supplied arguments. EMR accepts these arguments and forwards them to the corresponding installation script as bootstrap action arguments.

Tag.name: Tag
Tag.description: A key/value pair containing user-defined metadata that you can associate with an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clu\ sters to track your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see Tagging Amazon EMR Resources.

Key.name: Key
Key.description: A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more information, see Tagging Amazon EMR Resources.

Value.name: Value
Value.description: A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more information, see Tagging Amazon EMR Resources.

JobFlowIds.name: JobFlowIds
JobFlowIds.description: A list of job flows to be shutdown.

VolumeSpecification.name: VolumeSpecification
VolumeSpecification.description: EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, and size(GiB) that will be requested for the EBS volume attached to an EC2 instance in the cluster.

VolumeType.name: VolumeType
VolumeType.description: The volume type. Volume types supported are gp2, io1, standard.

Iops.name: Iops
Iops.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.

SizeInGB.name: SizeInGB
SizeInGB.description: The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.

title: Amazon Elastic MapReduce
description: Amazon Elastic MapReduce (Amazon EMR) is a web service that makes it easy to process large amounts of data efficiently. Amazon EMR uses Hadoop processing combined with several AWS products to do tasks such as web indexing, data mining, log file analysis, machine learning, scientific simulation, and data warehousing.

methods.description: AddInstanceGroups adds an instance group to a running cluster.

AddInstanceGroups.name: AddInstanceGroups
AddInstanceGroups.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: AddJobFlowSteps adds new steps to a running job flow. A maximum of 256 steps are allowed in each job flow. If your job flow is long-running (such as a Hive data warehouse) or complex, you may require more than 256 steps to process your data. You can bypass the 256-step limitation in various ways, including using the SSH shell to connect to the master node and submitting queries directly to the software running on the master node, such as Hive and Hadoop. For more information on how to do this, go to Add More than 256 Steps to a Job Flow in the Amazon Elastic MapReduce Developer's Guide. A step specifies the location of a JAR file stored either on the master node of the job flow or in Amazon S3. Each step is performed by the main function of the main class of the JAR file. The main class can be specified either in the manifest of the JAR or by using the MainFunction parameter of the step. Elastic MapReduce executes each step in the order listed. For a step to be considered complete, the main function must exit with a zero exit code and all Hadoop jobs started while the step was running must have completed and run successfully. You can only add steps to a job flow that is in one of the following states: STARTING, BOOTSTRAPPING, RUNNING, or WAITING.

AddJobFlowSteps.name: AddJobFlowSteps
AddJobFlowSteps.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Adds tags to an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clusters to track your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see Tagging Amazon EMR Resources.

AddTags.name: AddTags
AddTags.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Creates a security configuration using EMR Security Configurations, which are stored in the service. Security Configurations enable you to more easily create a configuration, reuse it, and apply it whenever a cluster is created.

methods.description: Provides cluster-level details including status, hardware and software configuration, VPC settings, and so on. For information about the cluster steps, see ListSteps.

DescribeCluster.name: DescribeCluster
DescribeCluster.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description:
This API is deprecated and will eventually be removed. We recommend you use ListClusters, DescribeCluster, ListSteps, ListInstanceGroups and ListBootstrapActions instead. DescribeJobFlows returns a list of job flows that match all of the supplied parameters. The parameters can include a list of job flow IDs, job flow states, and restrictions on job flow creation date and time. Regardless of supplied parameters, only job flows created within the last two months are returned. If no parameters are supplied, then job flows matching either of the following criteria are returned:
  • Job flows created and completed in the last two weeks
  • Job flows created within the last two months that are in one of the following states: RUNNING, WAITING, SHUTTING_DOWN, STARTING
Amazon Elastic MapReduce can return a maximum of 512 job flow descriptions.

DescribeJobFlows.name: DescribeJobFlows
DescribeJobFlows.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides the details of a security configuration by returning the configuration JSON.

DescribeSecurityConfiguration.name: DescribeSecurityConfiguration
DescribeSecurityConfiguration.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides more detail about the cluster step.

DescribeStep.name: DescribeStep
DescribeStep.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides information about the bootstrap actions associated with a cluster.

ListBootstrapActions.name: ListBootstrapActions
ListBootstrapActions.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides the status of all clusters visible to this AWS account. Allows you to filter the list of clusters based on certain criteria; for example, filtering by cluster creation date and time or by status. This call returns a maximum of 50 clusters per call, but returns a marker to track the paging of the cluster list across multiple ListClusters calls.

ListClusters.name: ListClusters
ListClusters.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides all available details about the instance groups in a cluster.

ListInstanceGroups.name: ListInstanceGroups
ListInstanceGroups.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides information about the cluster instances that Amazon EMR provisions on behalf of a user when it creates the cluster. For example, this operation indicates when the EC2 instances reach the Ready state, when instances become available to Amazon EMR to use for jobs, and the IP addresses for cluster instances, etc.

ListInstances.name: ListInstances
ListInstances.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Lists all the security configurations visible to this account, providing their creation dates and times, and their names. This call returns a maximum of 50 clusters per call, but returns a marker to track the paging of the cluster list across multiple ListSecurityConfigurations calls.

ListSecurityConfigurations.name: ListSecurityConfigurations
ListSecurityConfigurations.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Provides a list of steps for the cluster.

ListSteps.name: ListSteps
ListSteps.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: ModifyInstanceGroups modifies the number of nodes and configuration settings of an instance group. The input parameters include the new target instance count for the group and the instance group ID. The call will either succeed or fail atomically.

ModifyInstanceGroups.name: ModifyInstanceGroups
ModifyInstanceGroups.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Removes tags from an Amazon EMR resource. Tags make it easier to associate clusters in various ways, such as grouping clusters to track your Amazon EMR resource allocation costs. For more information, see Tagging Amazon EMR Resources. The following example removes the stack tag with value Prod from a cluster:

RemoveTags.name: RemoveTags
RemoveTags.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: RunJobFlow creates and starts running a new job flow. The job flow will run the steps specified. Once the job flow completes, the cluster is stopped and the HDFS partition is lost. To prevent loss of data, configure the last step of the job flow to store results in Amazon S3. If the JobFlowInstancesConfig KeepJobFlowAliveWhenNoSteps parameter is set to TRUE, the job flow will transition to the WAITING state rather than shutting down once the steps have completed. For additional protection, you can set the JobFlowInstancesConfig TerminationProtected parameter to TRUE to lock the job flow and prevent it from being terminated by API call, user intervention, or in the event of a job flow error. A maximum of 256 steps are allowed in each job flow. If your job flow is long-running (such as a Hive data warehouse) or complex, you may require more than 256 steps to process your data. You can bypass the 256-step limitation in various ways, including using the SSH shell to connect to the master node and submitting queries directly to the software running on the master node, such as Hive and Hadoop. For more information on how to do this, go to Add More than 256 Steps to a Job Flow in the Amazon Elastic MapReduce Developer's Guide. For long running job flows, we recommend that you periodically store your results.

RunJobFlow.name: RunJobFlow
RunJobFlow.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: SetTerminationProtection locks a job flow so the Amazon EC2 instances in the cluster cannot be terminated by user intervention, an API call, or in the event of a job-flow error. The cluster still terminates upon successful completion of the job flow. Calling SetTerminationProtection on a job flow is analogous to calling the Amazon EC2 DisableAPITermination API on all of the EC2 instances in a cluster. SetTerminationProtection is used to prevent accidental termination of a job flow and to ensure that in the event of an error, the instances will persist so you can recover any data stored in their ephemeral instance storage. To terminate a job flow that has been locked by setting SetTerminationProtection to true, you must first unlock the job flow by a subsequent call to SetTerminationProtection in which you set the value to false. For more information, go to Protecting a Job Flow from Termination in the Amazon Elastic MapReduce Developer's Guide.

SetTerminationProtection.name: SetTerminationProtection
SetTerminationProtection.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Sets whether all AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users under your account can access the specified job flows. This action works on running job flows. You can also set the visibility of a job flow when you launch it using the VisibleToAllUsers parameter of RunJobFlow. The SetVisibleToAllUsers action can be called only by an IAM user who created the job flow or the AWS account that owns the job flow.

SetVisibleToAllUsers.name: SetVisibleToAllUsers
SetVisibleToAllUsers.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: TerminateJobFlows shuts a list of job flows down. When a job flow is shut down, any step not yet completed is canceled and the EC2 instances on which the job flow is running are stopped. Any log files not already saved are uploaded to Amazon S3 if a LogUri was specified when the job flow was created. The maximum number of JobFlows allowed is 10. The call to TerminateJobFlows is asynchronous. Depending on the configuration of the job flow, it may take up to 5-20 minutes for the job flow to completely terminate and release allocated resources, such as Amazon EC2 instances.

TerminateJobFlows.name: TerminateJobFlows
TerminateJobFlows.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url
